gurmukhi: ਕੇਤਕ ਚਾਬ ਗੲੀ ਮੁਖਿ ਕਾਲਕਾ ਕੇਤਨ ਕੇ ਸਿਰ ਚੰਡਿ ਕਟੇ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Ketakchaah Gado Moukh(i) Kaalkaa Ketan Ke Sir Channd(i) Kate Hai||
translation: Many have been chewed by Kali with her mouth, and many have been beheaded by Chandi.

gurmukhi: ਸ੍ਰੳੁਨਤ ਸਿੰਧ ਭੲਿਓ ਧਰ ਮੈ ਰਨ ਛਾਡ ਗੲੇ ੲਿਕ ਦੈਤ ਫਟੇ ਹੈ ||
transliteration: Sraounat Sindh Bhaio Dhar Mai Ran Chhaad Gad Ik Dait Phate Hai||
translation: A sea of blood hath appeared on the earth; many warriors have left the battlefield and many are lying wounded.

gurmukhi: ਸੁੰਭ ਪੈ ਜਾੲੇ ਕਹੀ ਤਿਨ ੲਿੳੁ ਬਹੁ ਬੀਰ ਮਹਾਂ ਤਿਹ ਠੳੁਰ ਲਟੇ ਹੈ ||੧੮੨||
transliteration: Sounbh Pai Jaae Kahoo Tin Io Bahu Boor Mahaan Tih Thaur Late Hai||182||
translation: Those who have fled, they have told Sumbh like this: “Many heroes are lying (dead in that place.”182.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖਿ ਭੲਿਅਾਨਕ ਜੁੱਧ ਕੋ ਕੀਨੋ ਬਿਸਨ ਬਿਚਾਰ ||
transliteration: Dekh(i) Bhaiaanak Juddh Ko Koono Bisan Bichaar||
translation: Seeing such a violent war, Vishnu thought;

gurmukhi: ਸਕਤਿ ਸਹਾੲਿਤ ਕੇ ਨਮਿਤ ਭੇਜੀ ਰਨਹਿ ਮੰਝਾਰ ||੧੮੩||
transliteration: Sakat(i) Sahaait Ke Namit Bhejoo Ranah(i) Manjhaar||183||
translation: And sent the powers for the help of the goddess in the battlefield.183.

gurmukhi: ਅਾੲਿਸ ਪਾੲਿ ਸਭੈ ਸਕਤੀ ਚਲਿ ਕੈ ਤਹਾਂ ਚੰਡ ਪ੍ਰਚੰਡ ਪੈ ਅਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Aais Paae Sabhai Saktoo Chal(i) Kai Tahaan Channd Prachanndd Pai Aaoo||
translation: As commanded by Vishnu, the powers of all the gods came for help for powerful Chandi.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵੀ ਕਹਿਓ ਤਿਨ ਕੋ ਕਰ ਅਾਦਰੁ ਅਾੲੀ ਭਲੇ ਜਨੁ ਬੋਲਿ ਪਠਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Devoo Kahio Tin Ko Kar Aadar(i) Aaoo Bhale Jan(u) Bol(i) Pathaaoo||
translation: The goddess, in reverence, said to them: “Welcome, you have come as though I have called you.”

gurmukhi: ਤਾ ਛਬਿ ਕੀ ੳੁਪਮਾ ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਕਵਿ ਨੇ ਅਪਨੇ ਮਨ ਮੈ ਲਖਿ ਪਾੲੀ ||
transliteration: Taa Chhab(i) Koo Oupmaa At(i) Hoo Kav(i) Ne Apne Man Mai Lakh(i) Paaoo||
translation: The poet hath imagined well in his mind the glory of that occasion.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਨਹੁ ਸਾਵਨ ਮਾਸ ਨਦੀ ਚਲਿ ਕੈ ਜਲਰਾਸਿ ਮੈ ਅਾਨ ਸਮਾੲੀ ||੧੮੪||
transliteration: Maanoh Saavan Maas Nadoo Chal(i) Kai Jalraas(i) Mai Aan Samaaoo||184||
translation: It seemed that the stream of Sawan (the rainy month) hath come and merged in the sea.184.

gurmukhi: ਦੇਖਿ ਮਹਾਂ ਦਲੁ ਦੇਵਨ ਕੋ ਬਰ ਬੀਰ ਸੁ ਸਾਮੁਹਿ ਜੁੱਧ ਕੋ ਧਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Dekh(i) Mahaan Dal(u) Devan Ko Bar Boor Su Saamuh(i) Juddh Ko Dhaae||
translation: Seeing the great many of the demons, the warriors of the powers of gods went in front of them for war.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਨਨਿ ਸਾਥਿ ਹਨੇ ਬਲੁ ਕੈ ਰਨ ਮੈ ਬਹੁ ਅਾਵਤ ਬੀਰ ਗਿਰਾੲੇ ||
transliteration: Banan(i) Saath(i) Hane Bal(u) Kai Ran Mai Bahu Aavat Boor Giraae||
translation: With great force killed many with their arrows and caused the confronting warriors to lie dead in the battlefield.
